Use recycled paper for invitations and decorations. Instead of traditional paper invitations, consider using recycled paper or digital invitations to reduce paper waste. For decorations, use reusable or recyclable materials such as burlap, twine, or upcycled floral arrangements.

Choose eco-friendly transportation. Encourage guests to carpool or use public transportation to reduce carbon emissions. Consider renting electric vehicles or bicycles for transportation during the wedding.

Serve locally sourced and organic food. Choose locally sourced and organic food options for the reception to reduce the carbon footprint of transportation. Additionally, consider using compostable or biodegradable plates, utensils, and cups to reduce waste.

Use renewable energy sources. Consider using renewable energy sources such as solar panels or wind turbines to power the wedding. This not only reduces the carbon footprint but also adds a unique touch to the wedding.

Use eco-friendly favors. Instead of traditional favors such as chocolate or candy, consider using eco-friendly favors such as seed packets, reusable tote bags, or beeswax wraps. This not only reduces waste but also promotes sustainability.
